headline: Chicken Piccata with Fettuccine
description: Chicken piccata served over fettuccine is a quick Italian-inspired meal to prepare for weeknight dinners or gourmet dinner parties.
name: Chicken Piccata with Fettuccine
recipeIngredient: 1 pound chicken breasts, cut into four 1/2-inch thick pieces
0.5 lemon, cut into wedges, or as desired
4 sprigs fresh parsley, or as desired

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in the fettuccine, bring back to a boil, and cook pasta over medium heat until cooked through but still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain.
Whisk flour and lemon-pepper seasoning together in a shallow bowl; dredge chicken through mixture until evenly coated, shaking excess back into bowl.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook chicken until light golden brown and no longer pink in the center, 6 to 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer chicken to a plate, retaining oil mixture in the skillet.

Mix white wine, lemon juice, water, and chicken bouillon granules into oil mixture in the skillet. Bring liquid to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon until sauce is slightly reduced, 2 to 4 minutes. Stir capers into sauce.
Divide pasta among serving plates; top with chicken. Spoon sauce over chicken and garnish with lemon wedges and parsley.

review.reviewBody:
Very tasty dish. I used homemade chicken stock instead of the granules. (guests were late so it was on stove much longer than the recipe called for) so the liquid reduced substantially. I kept adding chicken stock and the result was a very lemony sauce, and I added a bit of lemon zest as well. Goes terrifically with capers. 
Loved it. Will make this again.

Chicken recipe portion is delicious. Make sure to pound the chicken to soften it up. The sauce portion was not so great. I did not have bouillon so maybe that is where it went wrong. I used Pinot Grigio and it was just too bitter and not a great flavor. Perhaps white wine works better or maybe adding more water and less wine. Otherwise was great

This is delicious and EVERYONE raved about it. And it's not a hard dish to make. I didn't have lemon juice so I used lime. We loved it! I made half again the recipe because it's a little small for four people, and when I made it half as much again, it was about perfect for four. It could easily be doubled. For white wine, I used Pinot Grigio
I will make it again delicious
So GOOD!!! Only I made & put over linguini !
Made this for Mother's Day and my family loved it.

I made a mix of this recipe with the Quick Chicken Piccata recipe from this site. I pounded the chicken so it was very thin so cooking time was around 2 minutes per side. I didn't have lemon-pepper seasoning, so I put lemon zest into the flour with pepper and cayenne pepper. I used 1/3 cup of lemon juice, 1/4 cup of water, 3TBS cold, unsalted butter; and I added a bunch of parsley on top for serving. It is really a combination of both recipes. Everyone liked it; two asked for the recipe. Oh, I also added a c an of cut-up artichoke hearts.

The flavor was nice and very light but it was just ok. I had to make double the sauce and it still wasn't enough. I made a recipe from Allrecipes previously that I thought was better so I'll look for that the next time.
Amazing dish! I didn't change a thing!
I never met a chicken piccata I didn't like, and this is no exception. It was delicious.
